hooks.hook: I have to admit something about client retention strategies...  I didn’t use to focus on them as much as I should have and it almost killed my business!   I was so focused on the new business and the shiny fancy new clients that I wasn’t looking after the ones I already had.   It was only after a frank conversation with my accountant that I realised that actually I was going to have to start from scratch every month.   I was horrified.  I immediately put together some client retention strategies to make sure I took care of the clients I already had.   A year on and my revenue has doubled and that’s without taking on anymore clients.   All because of the right client retention strategies.
"I wish I could afford me!" - Handling 'you’re too expensive'.  You might have heard this before.
Getting first clients isn't easy - how do you make sure you get the right ones?

I took years to realise I was undervaluing my services - and still do from time to time.   There's a big difference between being competitive and undervaluing what you do.  If you are doing the latter, it can be a hard habit to break - and a costly one!  Know your worth, ask your clients what value they get as a result of working with you and more importantly, believe what they tell you.

hooks.topic: Yes, I met a friend at a co-working

hooks.hook: Met a friend at a co-working event a few years ago - and we've been besties ever since! LICGG is a great place to work and meet others. Plus, it's got a great vibe, and the food is delicious!
hooks.topic: Yes, I met a friend at a co-working

hooks.hook: I can't believe how much I got done - talk about a productive day!  I met someone new and we hit it off straight away - we were both there to get things done!  It was so refreshing to be around other people, I miss that so much - it's been a long few months working from home on my own.  I've met a new friend, we're both getting our work done and still having great conversations and a few laughs - we'll be back, that's for sure!  #ThePowerOfCommunity #coworking #friendship
hooks.topic: Yes, I met a friend at a co-working

hooks.hook: By the time we got on a call, the client had spent 13 hours on the internet researching.   The trouble is, the internet is a very big place and there are a lot of people who think they are experts.   No wonder they were confused!  That's why I have established relationships with a trusted network of professionals.  I want to make your life easier and I can't do that unless I know who I am recommending.  Instead of being one of those voices, I am YOUR voice when it comes to other services.
hooks.topic: I had a client meeting yesterday where they

hooks.hook: Everything was fine, until it wasn't.  We were a happy, content family and then loneliness arrived.  It was the most debilitating feeling - and it struck from nowhere.  The weird thing is, I could be in a room full of people and still feel lonely.  I'm so grateful for the teachings I've benefited from which I can utilize, and also share with others when it comes to dealing with loneliness.  It's a silent killer and doesn't have to be.
